forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 53. South southwest wind around 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 10 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As night settles over Downtown San Francisco, the air carries the promise of rain, a gentle reminder of spring’s unpredictable spirit. Currently, the low temperatures hover around a cool 53 degrees, accompanied by a soft, south-southwest wind whispering at ten miles per hour. A thick blanket of clouds stretches overhead, shrouding the city in a muted yet mysterious ambiance, and the impending rain showers are expected to blossom into existence after 11 PM. The anticipation hangs in the air, a 60% chance of precipitation that may add a delicate sheen to the city’s streets.

Looking forward to Monday, the skies will play a game between clouds and fleeting patches of sunlight, with temperatures lingering in the mid to upper 50s. The brisk west-southwest winds will pick up, possibly creating a chill that demands appropriate attire—think layers, and perhaps a light raincoat to ward off the dampness. A walk along the Embarcadero could be refreshing, where the sound of distant soft rain mingles with the ebb and flow of the Bay, while a visit to a cozy café could offer solace from the evening's cool embrace. Engage in the moment; it’s the kind of night that invites reflection and perhaps a good book, tucked away in the comfort of home as the heartbeat of the city softly hums outside.
